AI.theoretical_framework: 基于目标函数在PTO决策中的不对称性，提出后估计调整方法。
AI.method: 开发了一种数据驱动的后估计调整方法，并在特定曲率条件下简化为闭式表达式。
AI.findings: 调整方法在理论和数值实验中均优于标准PTO，显著提升收益，尤其在小样本场景中。
AI.theory_contributions: 为PTO框架提供了理论改进，明确了调整方法的适用条件和性能提升。
AI.practical_contributions: 方法适用于多种定价问题，特别适合新产品定价或历史价格变化有限的情况。

title: Decoding Compliance: NLP-Driven Interpretation of Financial Regulations and Legal Texts
affiliations: Independent Researcher, Independent Researcher and Independent Researcher

detail.title: Decoding Compliance: NLP-Driven Interpretation of Financial Regulations and Legal Texts
detail.abstract: This research explores the application of Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques to decode and interpret complex financial regulations and legal texts, which are critical for ensuring compliance in the financial industry. The purpose of this study is to develop an automated framework that aids compliance officers and legal professionals by transforming dense regulatory language into structured, actionable insights. Employing state-of-the-art NLP methods-including named entity recognition, relation extraction, and transformer-based language models-our approach systematically parses legal documents to identify obligations, conditions, and entities involved. Key findings demonstrate that the NLP-driven system significantly improves the accuracy and efficiency of compliance interpretation, reducing manual review time and minimizing human error. The study concludes that integrating NLP technologies into compliance workflows can transform regulatory adherence processes, offering scalable solutions for dynamic and evolving legal landscapes.

AI.tldr: 本研究探讨了自然语言处理（NLP）技术在解码和解释复杂金融法规和法律文本中的应用，旨在开发一个自动化框架，帮助合规人员和法律专业人士将复杂的法规语言转化为结构化、可操作的见解。

title: Fund Management Layer: A New Modular Primitive for Capital Markets
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: Fund Management Layer: A New Modular Primitive for Capital Markets

declarations.declarationOfInterest: The author declares no conflicts of interest. This research was conducted independently with no financial relationships with any organizations that could be perceived to have influenced the work.
declarations.ethicsApproval: Not applicable. This theoretical research did not involve human participants, patient data, or animal subjects.
declarations.funderStatement: This research was self-funded by the author as independent academic work.

detail.abstract: The global fund management industry, valued at over $103 trillion in assets under management, operates on infrastructure fundamentally unchanged since the Investment Company Act of 1940. This paper introduces the Fund Management Layer (FML), a novel architectural primitive that reconceptualises fund operations as modular, composable infrastructure rather than monolithic entities. Through systematic abstraction of fund management functions into standardised modules-creation, compliance, allocation, accounting, distribution, governance, and liquidity-FML reduces fund establishment costs by 99.98% (from >$500,000 to <$100) and setup time by 99% (from 180 days to 5 minutes). This paradigm shift enables previously impossible fund structures including micro-funds ($10,000 AUM), flash funds (1-hour duration), and globally accessible investment vehicles with $10 minimums. We present the theoretical framework, architectural design, and empirical analysis demonstrating how treating fund management as infrastructure rather than institution can democratise capital allocation while enhancing regulatory compliance and investor protection.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为Fund Management Layer（FML）的新架构，将基金管理重新概念化为模块化、可组合的基础设施，而非单一实体。通过标准化模块（如创建、合规、分配等），FML将基金设立成本降低99.98%，时间缩短99%，并支持新型基金结构（如微型基金、闪存基金）。
AI.research_question: 如何通过模块化和标准化重新设计基金管理基础设施，以降低成本、提高效率并支持新型基金结构？
AI.motivation: 全球基金管理行业规模庞大（103万亿美元），但其基础设施自1940年以来未变，导致高成本和低效率。FML旨在解决这一问题。
AI.theoretical_framework: 本文基于模块化和基础设施理论，提出将基金管理功能抽象为标准化模块的框架。
AI.method: 通过系统性抽象基金管理功能为模块，设计FML架构，并进行实证分析。

detail.abstract:
This white paper examines persistent operational barriers to equitable healthcare access, especially in low-resource environments. It explores the breakdown between service availability and real-world access, even when facilities and services technically exist. Drawing from evidence across African contexts and aligning with global health policy shifts, the paper proposes a layered model of strengthening access that addresses supply-side coordination, demand-side responsiveness, and governance.

Emphasis is placed on embedding access reforms into routine health operations, rather than treating access as a stand-alone goal. Practical recommendations are provided to align donor, government, and private actors toward sustainable access outcomes, with applicability beyond low-income settings.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了在资源匮乏环境中实现公平医疗服务的持续运营障碍，提出了一种分层模型，强调将改革融入常规医疗运营，并提供实用建议。

AI.method: 通过分析非洲背景和全球政策，提出分层模型，并结合实际案例。

AI.theory_contributions: 提出了一个整合供给侧、需求侧和治理的分层模型，丰富了医疗服务可及性的理论框架。
AI.practical_contributions: 提供了将改革融入常规运营的实用建议，适用于低收入及其他环境。

detail.abstract: This paper presents a comprehensive systematization of second-degree price discrimination available to a firm selling multiple products. The accumulated literature has been systematically reviewed and organized to elucidate how second-degree price discrimination may be applied according to the nature of the relationships among the products offered-specifically, whether they are horizontally differentiated and substitutable, or vertically differentiated and substitutable, or complementary. Systematizing these accumulated research findings can broaden the range of practical pricing options available to companies. To ensure these ideas can be applied at the practical level of business operations, this paper has deliberately omitted the formulas and presented the concept of the sales method.

AI.tldr: 本文对企业在销售多产品时可采用的二级价格歧视进行了系统化梳理，总结了不同产品关系（水平差异化与替代、垂直差异化与替代、互补）下的应用方式，为企业提供了更广泛的定价选择。
AI.research_question: 企业在销售多产品时如何根据产品关系（水平差异化、垂直差异化或互补）应用二级价格歧视？
AI.motivation: 现有文献对二级价格歧视的研究分散且缺乏系统性，本文旨在填补这一空白，为企业提供实用的定价策略参考。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于二级价格歧视理论，结合产品关系（水平差异化、垂直差异化、互补）的分析框架。
AI.method: 系统性文献综述，整理并分类现有研究成果，省略数学公式以突出实用性。
AI.findings: 不同产品关系下（水平差异化与替代、垂直差异化与替代、互补）的二级价格歧视应用方式被明确分类和总结。
AI.theory_contributions: 系统化了二级价格歧视的理论框架，填补了现有研究的分散性。
AI.practical_contributions: 为企业提供了基于产品关系的二级价格歧视定价策略，增强了实际操作的可行性。
